commands.name: Adv Addr Set
commands.description: Set the device's BLE advertisement address used for all BLE advertisment messages sent by the device.

commands.name: Adv Addr Get
commands.description: Get the device's BLE advertisement address.

commands.name: Channel Map Set
commands.description: Set the channel map for advertisement packets. The device will send the advertisement packets on all enabled channels in increasing order. The channel map parameter is a bitmap, where the first bit represents channel 37, the second bit channel 38, and the third bit channel 39. The rest of the byte is ignored. Set to `0x07` to enable all channels, `0x01` to only enable channel 37, and so on.

commands.name: Channel Map Get
commands.description: Get the channel map used for advertisement packets.

commands.name: TX Power Set
commands.description: Set the transmission power of the radio. Must be a valid enumeration in `serial_cmd_config_tx_power_value`.

commands.name: TX Power Get
commands.description: Get the transmission power of the radio.

commands.name: UUID Set
commands.description: Set the device UUID used for identifying the device during provisioning. If the UUID isn't set, the device will use a preprogrammed UUID.

commands.name: UUID Get
commands.description: Get the device UUID used for identifying the device during provisioning.

commands.name: Scan Start
commands.description: Start reporting of incoming unprovisioned beacons.

commands.name: Scan Stop
commands.description: Stop reporting of incoming unprovisioned beacons.

commands.name: Provision
commands.description: Start provisioning of a device. When a provisioning link has been successfully established, a _Provisioning Link Established_ event is received. If an error occurs, a _Provisioning Link Closed_ event is received. After a link has been established, a _Provisioning Capabilities Received_ event will be emitted upon receiving the peer node's OOB capabilities. To continue the provisioning process, a _Provisioning OOB Use_ command must be sent to select which kind of OOB authentication to use.

commands.name: Listen
commands.description: As an uprovisioned device, listen for incoming provisioning requests.

commands.name: OOB Use
commands.description:
Used to respond to the _Provisioning Capabilities Received_ event. It is used to select which kind of OOB authentication method to use. The values can be found in nrf_mesh_prov.h.

If authentication is enabled, the application will receive a _Provisioning Auth Request_ event requesting authentication data. A _Provisioning ECDH Request_ will be received when the provisioner needs to calculate the ECDH shared secret for the nodes. The _Provisioning Complete_ event is received when the provisioning procedure has completed successfully. At this point, a provisioner must wait for the _Provisioning Link Closed_ event before re-using the provisioning context.

commands.name: Auth Data
commands.description: Used to respond to a _Provisioning Auth Request_ event. It passes OOB authentication data back to the mesh stack.

commands.name: ECDH Secret
commands.description: Used to respond to a _Provisioning ECDH Request_ event. It passes the calculated ECDH shared secret back to the mesh stack.

commands.name: Keypair Set
commands.description: Send a public/private keypair to the device. These keys are used for some of the encryption involved in provisioning.

commands.name: Capabilities Set
commands.description: Used to set the out-of-band authentication capabilities of a device. The values for the parameters can be found in the various defines in the nrf_mesh_prov.h header file.

commands.description:
Flash the bank with the given firmware type. If successful, this serial call does not produce a command response. Note that all volatile memory will be lost, as the device will restart.

If the new firmware supports serial communication, the device issues a device started event when it is ready to receive new commands.

events.name: Cmd Rsp
events.description: Command response. Each command (except the Echo command) immediately gets a command response. See the individual commands for their responses.

events.name: Device Started
events.description: The device has started, and is ready for commands. No commands will be accepted before this event, and it is guaranteed to be the first event to cross the serial.

events.name: Device Echo Rsp
events.description: Response to the Echo command. Contains the exact same data as received in the echo command.

events.name: Device Internal Event
events.description: Internal stack event occurred.

events.name: Application
events.description: Application event, only sent by the device application.

events.name: SAR Start
events.description: Start of a Segmentation and Reassembly message from the device.

events.name: SAR Continue
events.description: Continuation of a Segmentation and Reassembly message from the device.

events.name: DFU Req Relay
events.description: Received a request from another device to act as a relay in a DFU transaction.

events.name: DFU Req Source
events.description: Recevied a request from another device to act as a source in a DFU transaction.

events.name: DFU Start
events.description: The current DFU operation started its data transfer stage.

events.name: DFU End
events.description: The current DFU operation ended its data transfer stage.

events.name: DFU Bank Available
events.description: A DFU firmware bank is available for flashing.

events.name: DFU Firmware Outdated
events.description: The mesh has received a secure notification indicating that the framework is out of date. Call _DFU Request_ to initiate a request to receive the firmware upgrade.

events.name: DFU Firmware Outdated No Auth
events.description: The mesh has received an insecure notification indicating that the framework is out of date. Call _Direct Firmware Upgrade Request_ to initiate a request to receive the firmware upgrade.

events.description: Not implemented.

events.description: Not implemented.

events.name: Openmesh TX
events.description: Not implemented.

events.name: Prov Unprovisioned Received
events.description: The node received an unprovisioned beacon. Requires scanning to be enabled with the _Provisioning Scan Enable_ command.

events.name: Prov Link Established
events.description: The given provisioning link has been established.

events.name: Prov Link Closed
events.description: The given provisioning link has been closed. If received before a _Provisioning Complete_ event, the link was closed because of an error.

events.name: Prov Caps Received
events.description: The device received provisioning capabilities on the provisioning link with the given context ID.

events.name: Prov Invite Received
events.description: The device received provisioning invite, so it can start identifying itself using any means it can.

events.name: Prov Start Received
events.description: The device received provisioning start meaning that the provisioning process has been started and will stop identifying itself.

events.name: Prov Complete
events.description: The provisioning process was successfully completed.

events.name: Prov Auth Request
events.description: Static authentication data is required to continue. Use the _Provisioning AuthData_ command to respond to this event.

events.name: Prov ECDH Request
events.description: An ECDH shared secret must be calculated. Use the _Provisioning ECDH Secret_ command to respond to this event.

events.name: Prov Output Request
events.description: The device is required to do an action the user can recognize and use for authentication.

events.name: Prov Failed
events.description: The provisioning procedure failed.

events.name: Mesh Message Received Unicast
events.description: The mesh framework received a message matching a registered local unicast address, with the given parameters and data.

events.name: Mesh Message Received Subscription
events.description: The mesh framework received a message matching one of the registered subscription addresses, with the given parameters and data.

events.name: Mesh TX Complete
events.description: A radio packet TX has completed.

events.name: Mesh IV Update Notification
events.description: The IV update procedure has been triggered for the network with the given index.

events.name: Mesh Key Refresh Notification
events.description: A network has entered a new phase in the key refresh procedure.

events.name: Mesh Heartbeat Received
events.description: A heartbeat message has been received. To control the heartbeat subscriptions of the device through the local Configuration Client, add any mesh device key through _Device Key_ and bind the provided handle to the device Configuration Server through _Config Server Bind_. Use the provided device key handle to configure the device.

events.name: Mesh IV Entry Set Notification
events.description: The mesh config entry for the IV index has been set.

events.name: Mesh SeqNum Entry Set Notification
events.description: The mesh config entry for the next sequence number block has been set.

events.name: Mesh SAR Failed
events.description: A Mesh transmission of a SAR packet failed.

events.name: Model Specific
events.description: An event generated by one of the initialized models. Model ID and event type is provided by each event. Further model specific information is provided as part of the data field.
